      • binaryRowOp

        public AColGroup binaryRowOp(BinaryOperator op,
                             double[] v,
                             boolean sparseSafe,
                             boolean left)
        Description copied from class: AColGroup
        Perform a binary row operation.
        Specified by:
        binaryRowOp in class AColGroup
        Parameters:
        op - The operation to execute
        v - The vector of values to apply, should be same length as dictionary length.
        sparseSafe - True if the operation return 0 on all instances of values in v -- op(v[?], 0)
        left - Specifies if the operation is executed on the left or right side of the values contained.
        Returns:
        A updated column group with the new values.

      • getValuesAsBlock

        public MatrixBlock getValuesAsBlock()
        Description copied from class: AColGroup
        Returns the ColGroup as a MatrixBlock. Used as a fall back solution in case a operation is not supported. Use in connection to getIfCountsType to get if the values are repeated.
        Specified by:
        getValuesAsBlock in class AColGroup
        Returns:
        Matrix Block of the contained Values. Possibly contained in groups.

      • tsmm

        public void tsmm(double[] result,
                 int numColumns)
        Description copied from class: AColGroup
        Do a transposed self matrix multiplication on the left side t(x) %*% x. but only with this column group. This gives better performance since there is no need to iterate through all the rows of the matrix, but the execution can be limited to its number of distinct values. Note it only calculate the upper triangle
        Specified by:
        tsmm in class AColGroup
        Parameters:
        result - A row major dense allocation of a matrixBlock, of size [numColumns x numColumns]
        numColumns - The number of columns in the row major result matrix.

      • tsmm

        public void tsmm(double[] result,
                 int numColumns,
                 int idxStart,
                 int idxEnd)
        Description copied from class: AColGroup
        Do a transposed self matrix multiplication on the left side t(x) %*% x. but only with this column group, and only on a subset of the columns contained in this columnGroup. This gives better performance since there is no need to iterate through all the rows of the matrix, but the execution can be limited to its number of distinct values. Note it only calculate the upper triangle
        Specified by:
        tsmm in class AColGroup
        Parameters:
        result - A row major dense allocation of a matrixBlock, of size [numColumns x numColumns]
        numColumns - The number of columns in the row major result matrix.
        idxStart - The starting index in the _colIndexes.
        idxEnd - The ending index in the _colIndexes.

      • leftMultByAColGroup

        public void leftMultByAColGroup(AColGroup lhs,
                                MatrixBlock c)
        Description copied from class: AColGroup
        Left side matrix multiplication with a column group that is transposed.
        Specified by:
        leftMultByAColGroup in class AColGroup
        Parameters:
        lhs - The left hand side Column group to multiply with, the left hand side should be considered transposed.
        c - The result matrix to insert the result of the multiplication into

      • isDense

        public boolean isDense()
        Description copied from class: AColGroup
        Is dense, signals that the entire column group is allocated an processed. This is useful in Row wise min and max for instance, to avoid having to scan through each row to look for empty rows. an example where it is true is DDC, Const and Uncompressed. examples where false is OLE and RLE.
        Specified by:
        isDense in class AColGroup
        Returns:
        returns if the colGroup is allocated in a dense fashion.

      • copy

        public AColGroup copy()
        Description copied from class: AColGroup
        Get a copy of this column group. Depending on which column group is copied it is a deep or shallow copy. If the primitives for the underlying column groups is Immutable then only shallow copies is performed.
        Specified by:
        copy in class AColGroup
        Returns:
        Get a copy of this column group.

      • replace

        public AColGroup replace(double pattern,
                         double replace)
        Description copied from class: AColGroup
        Make a copy of the column group values, and replace all values that match pattern with replacement value.
        Specified by:
        replace in class AColGroup
        Parameters:
        pattern - The value to look for
        replace - The value to replace the other value with
        Returns:
        A new Column Group, reusing the index structure but with new values.
